div.id: Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Change
div.aria-label: fulton-warning Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Change
div.h5: Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Change

p.a: Read the Latest on Fulton County Closures and Service Changes

div.p:
Fulton County is expanding the availability of COVID-19 testing for residents with the addition of new testing sites. Each location offers free drive-through testing by appointment only. Additional testing sites are being added and this page will be updated to reflect those.
The three Fulton County sites are:

p.span:
• Fulton County Airport, 3900 Aviation Cir NW, Atlanta, GA 30336 (opened March 19)
• 4700 North Point Parkway (opening Tuesday, April 28)

div.p:
To schedule an appointment for any of these sites, residents should call 404-613-8150 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. weekdays and 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Saturdays. During the call, patients will speak with a trained staff member and receive a referral number and appointment time. Testing is offered free of charge.
Fulton County is also coordinating with other public and private agencies to increase the availability of COVID-19 testing throughout the community:

• Walgreen’s has opened a site in Alpharetta (Open April 24). Click for registration.
• CVS Health has operated a testing site at Georgia Tech (Open April 6). Click for registration.
• The Georgia National Guard has announced plans for new testing sites at Georgia State University and Greenbriar Mall. For an appointment at these sites, call 706-721-1852 or download the Augusta Health virtual screening app.
